title: Blundstone 585 Review: The Ultimate Guide to Australia's Most Popular Chelsea Boot
description: The Blundstone 585 has earned its reputation as one of the most comfortable and versatile Chelsea boots available today. After wearing these rustic brown leather boots through various seasons and terrains, I can confidently say they live up to the hype. Whether you're exploring national parks or navigating city streets, these boots deliver exceptional comfort and durability. Visit our homepage for more outdoor gear reviews and national park guides.

body:
Blundstone 585 Review: The Ultimate Guide to Australia's Most Popular Chelsea Boot

The Blundstone 585 has earned its reputation as one of the most comfortable and versatile Chelsea boots available today. After wearing these rustic brown leather boots through various seasons and terrains, I can confidently say they live up to the hype. Whether you're exploring national parks or navigating city streets, these boots deliver exceptional comfort and durability. Visit our homepage for more outdoor gear reviews and national park guides.

Table of Contents

  • What Makes the Blundstone 585 Special
  • My Personal Experience with the 585
  • Detailed Features and Construction
  • Sizing Guide and Fit
  • Blundstone 585 vs Other Models
  • Pros and Cons Analysis
  • Frequently Asked Questions
  • Conclusion

What Makes the Blundstone 585 Special

The Blundstone 585 represents everything that makes Australian craftsmanship legendary. Part of the prestigious Classics series, these boots are essentially the Original 500 series "turned up to max" – offering all the durability you expect with enhanced comfort and superior shock absorption. The rustic brown premium leather gives these boots a distinctive aged appearance right out of the box, making them look like they've been your trusted companions for years.

What sets the Blundstone Chelsea boots apart is their unique construction philosophy. Unlike traditional welted boots, the 585 features an injection-molded TPU outsole that creates a lighter, more flexible boot with exceptional out-of-the-box comfort. The SPS Max Comfort system includes XRD® Technology in the heel strike zone, providing outstanding shock absorption that makes these boots perfect for long days of hiking or urban exploration.

Key Features That Define the 585

  • Rustic brown premium water-resistant leather that develops character over time
  • Leather lining for enhanced comfort and breathability
  • Elastic side panels in complementary brown tones for easy on/off
  • Removable comfort footbed with XRD® shock absorption technology
  • TPU outsole that's oil and acid resistant for workplace safety

The versatility of these boots is remarkable. I've worn my 585s from the trails of Yellowstone to the streets of New York City, and they perform admirably in both environments. The rustic brown color pairs beautifully with everything from dark denim and flannel shirts to chinos and wool sweaters, making them a true four-season boot that transitions seamlessly from outdoor adventures to casual urban wear.

My Personal Experience with the 585

I purchased my first pair of Blundstone 585 boots three years ago after extensive research into Blundstone boots for national park adventures. What initially drew me to the 585 was the promise of superior comfort compared to the traditional 500 series, and I can confidently say these boots have exceeded every expectation.

During my first major test – a week-long photography expedition through the Rocky Mountains – the 585s proved their worth immediately. Unlike many boots that require a painful break-in period, these were comfortable from day one. The soft, supple leather and cushioned midsole meant I could walk for hours without the foot fatigue I'd experienced with other hiking boots. The elastic side panels made them incredibly easy to slip on and off at camp, which became a daily convenience I hadn't anticipated.

Real-World Performance Observations

After three years of regular wear, here's what I've learned about the 585s in various conditions:

  • Wet weather: Excellent in light rain and puddles, but requires treatment for heavy downpours
  • Winter conditions: Good traction on packed snow, but consider adding ice grips for icy trails
  • Hot weather: Surprisingly breathable for a leather boot, comfortable in 80°F+ temperatures
  • Rocky terrain: The thick sole provides excellent protection from sharp rocks

One memorable experience occurred during a sudden thunderstorm in Great Smoky Mountains. While the boots aren't fully waterproof, they kept my feet remarkably dry during the 20-minute trek back to the car. The water-resistant leather and sealed construction protected against everything except the most persistent water infiltration at the ankle opening.

The aging process of the rustic brown leather has been fascinating to watch. Initially, the boots had a somewhat artificial "distressed" appearance, but after hundreds of miles of wear, they've developed a genuine patina that tells the story of every adventure. The leather has become more supple and comfortable while maintaining its structural integrity, proving the quality of the materials used in construction.

Detailed Features and Construction

The construction of the Blundstone 585 reflects over 150 years of Australian bootmaking expertise. Every component is carefully engineered to provide maximum comfort while maintaining the durability that has made Blundstone a trusted name among workers, adventurers, and outdoor enthusiasts worldwide.

Premium Leather Upper

The rustic brown leather used in the 585 is a full-grain premium hide that's been specially treated to achieve its distinctive aged appearance. Unlike corrected grain leathers, this full-grain construction allows the boot to breathe naturally while developing a unique patina over time. The leather is water-resistant out of the box, though regular conditioning enhances this property significantly.

The multi-piece construction, with each seam double-stitched for durability, sets these apart from dressier Chelsea boots. This approach prioritizes longevity over aesthetics, ensuring the boots can handle whatever outdoor adventures you throw at them.

The elastic side panels deserve special mention – they're manufactured from a high-quality elastic that maintains its stretch and rebound even after years of use. The brown color perfectly complements the rustic leather, and the fabric pull tabs at front and back make the slip-on design incredibly convenient. I've compared these to Blundstone 500 boots, and the 585's elastic is noticeably superior in both feel and longevity.

Advanced Comfort Technology

The SPS Max Comfort system is where the 585 truly shines. The removable footbed features XRD® Technology in the heel strike zone, which provides exceptional shock absorption – crucial for long days on hard surfaces. The polyurethane midsole adds another layer of cushioning while maintaining durability.

The leather lining extends throughout the shaft, providing better breathability than synthetic alternatives. This natural material helps regulate temperature and moisture, making the boots comfortable in a wide range of conditions.

The injection-molded TPU outsole represents modern bootmaking at its finest. This process creates a lightweight, flexible sole that's bonded directly to the boot upper, eliminating the need for traditional stitching methods. While this means the boots aren't resoleable, the trade-off is immediate comfort and a significantly lighter boot that doesn't require the break-in period of traditional welted construction.

Check Current Price on Amazon

Sizing Guide and Fit

Getting the right fit with Blundstone 585 boots is crucial for comfort, and there are some important considerations that differ from typical American sizing. After helping dozens of fellow outdoor enthusiasts find their perfect fit, I've developed a comprehensive understanding of how these boots should fit and what to expect during the sizing process.

Understanding Blundstone Sizing

Blundstone uses Australian/UK sizing, which typically runs about one size smaller than US sizing. However, the 585 has some unique fit characteristics that set it apart from other models in the line:

  • True to size fit: Most people can order their normal US size in the 585
  • Wider fit option: If you prefer a roomier feel, go up half a size
  • Narrow feet: The 585's wider last may require sizing down for narrow-footed individuals
  • Thick sock accommodation: Consider your typical sock thickness when sizing

Unlike Blundstone 550 boots, which run narrower, the 585 has a more generous fit across the midfoot and toe box.

When trying on the 585s, you should feel a slight give in the heel and about a quarter-inch of space from your longest toe to the front of the boot. The boots will stretch slightly over the instep with wear but will never stretch lengthwise. This is crucial to remember – if your toes are hitting the front when new, the boots are too small and will never become comfortable.

My Personal Sizing Experience

I wear a size 10D on a Brannock device and typically take a 10 in most boots. With the 585, I found that a size 10 US (9 AU) fit perfectly with medium-weight hiking socks. The initial fit was snug but not tight, and after about a week of wear, they molded to my feet beautifully.

For comparison, I need a 10.5 in men's Blundstone boots from the Original 500 series, demonstrating how the 585's wider last accommodates feet more generously.

The included comfort insoles are a game-changer for fine-tuning fit. If you find your boots slightly too roomy, these additional insoles can be placed under the regular footbed to take up excess volume. This feature makes the 585 more forgiving than many boots in terms of achieving the perfect fit.

For those with specific foot issues, the removable footbed system allows for custom orthotics. I've successfully used the boots with both over-the-counter arch supports and custom orthotics, making them suitable for people with plantar fasciitis or other foot conditions that require additional support.

View Sizing Chart on Amazon

Blundstone 585 vs Other Models

Understanding how the Blundstone 585 compares to other models in the extensive Blundstone lineup is essential for making an informed purchase decision. Having personally tested multiple models over the years, I can provide detailed insights into how the 585 stacks up against its siblings and when you might choose one over another.

585 vs 500: Classics vs Originals

The most common comparison is between the 585 and the iconic 500. Both boots share the same essential design DNA, but the differences are significant:

  • Comfort: The 585 features superior cushioning and shock absorption
  • Leather: 585 uses softer, more supple leather that requires less break-in
  • Fit: 585 has a slightly wider, more accommodating fit
  • Price: 585 costs about $10-20 more than the 500
  • Lining: 585 features full leather lining vs partial lining in 500

The 585 is essentially the 500 "turned up to max" – if comfort is your primary concern, the small price premium is absolutely worthwhile. However, if you prefer the traditional break-in experience and slightly more structured feel, the Blundstone 500 remains an excellent choice.

When compared to the 550 model, the differences become more subtle but still important. The 550 sits between the 500 and 585 in terms of features and comfort. It offers some of the enhanced comfort features of the 585 but maintains more of the traditional Blundstone feel. For most people, I recommend jumping directly to the 585 for the best overall experience.

585 vs Work Boot Models

For those considering Blundstone work boots like the 990 or 992, the decision comes down to your specific needs:

  • Safety features: Work models include steel toe and electrical hazard protection
  • Durability: Work boots use more robust materials and construction
  • Weight: 585 is significantly lighter and more comfortable for casual wear
  • Style: 585 is more versatile for both work and casual environments

The 585 also compares favorably to women's Blundstone models. The unisex sizing means the same boot works for both men and women, though women may need to size down compared to their typical women's shoe size. The rustic brown color is particularly popular among female outdoor enthusiasts for its versatility.

For those considering alternatives like the thermal models (584, 566), the 585 offers better breathability for three-season use. The thermal models excel in extreme cold but can be uncomfortably warm in moderate temperatures. Unless you're specifically dealing with sub-zero conditions regularly, the 585's versatility makes it the better all-around choice.

Compare All Blundstone Models

Pros and Cons Analysis

After three years of intensive use and testing the Blundstone 585 in various conditions, I believe in providing an honest, balanced assessment. While these boots excel in many areas, they're not perfect for every situation or user. Understanding both the strengths and limitations will help you make an informed decision about whether the 585s are right for your needs.

Pros: What Makes the 585 Exceptional

  • Outstanding comfort: No break-in period required, comfortable from day one
  • Versatile styling: Works equally well for outdoor adventures and urban wear
  • Superior build quality: High-grade materials and excellent craftsmanship throughout
  • Convenient slip-on design: Easy to get on and off, perfect for frequent removal
  • Excellent shock absorption: XRD technology makes long days on hard surfaces comfortable
  • Beautiful aging: Rustic brown leather develops character and patina over time
  • Lightweight construction: Injection-molded sole keeps weight down without sacrificing durability
  • Good water resistance: Handles light rain and wet conditions well

Bottom line: These boots deliver on their promise of combining comfort, durability, and style in a way that few competitors match at this price point.

Cons: Areas Where the 585 Falls Short

  • Not resoleable: Injection-molded construction means you can't replace the sole
  • Limited water protection: Not fully waterproof, struggles in heavy rain or deep puddles
  • Price point: Premium pricing puts them out of reach for some budgets
  • Break-in for some: While minimal, people with narrow feet may need adjustment time
  • Limited ankle support: Low-cut design offers less support than hiking boots
  • Seasonal limitations: Not ideal for extreme cold without additional insulation
  • Traction concerns: Standard sole pattern can be slippery on wet rocks or ice

Reality check: While these limitations exist, none are deal-breakers for most users, and many can be addressed with proper care and realistic expectations.

User Review Summary

Amazon Customer (5 stars): "I've owned these for 2 years now and wear them almost daily. The comfort is incredible, and they've held up to everything I've thrown at them. The rustic brown has aged beautifully."

Reddit u/OutdoorEnthusiast (4 stars): "Great boots overall, but don't expect them to be completely waterproof. I learned that lesson the hard way during a particularly wet hike. Still love them for most conditions."

Quora User Review: "The 585s are my go-to boots for travel. They're comfortable enough for walking all day, stylish enough for dinner out, and durable enough to handle whatever adventure comes up. Worth every penny."

The key to happiness with the 585s is understanding what they are and aren't designed to do. They excel as a comfortable, versatile boot for daily wear, outdoor activities, and light hiking. They're not intended as serious mountaineering boots or full-weather protection. When used within their intended scope, few boots can match their combination of comfort, style, and durability. For outdoor enthusiasts looking for reliable outdoor boots, the 585 represents an excellent investment.

Read More Reviews on Amazon

Frequently Asked Questions

Are Blundstone 585 boots waterproof?

The Blundstone 585 boots are water-resistant, not fully waterproof. They feature premium water-resistant leather that handles light rain, puddles, and wet conditions very well. However, in heavy downpours or when submerged, water can eventually penetrate through the leather or ankle opening. For enhanced water protection, I recommend treating them regularly with a quality leather waterproofing product. This treatment significantly improves their water resistance and helps maintain the leather's condition over time.

How do Blundstone 585 boots fit compared to US sizes?

Blundstone uses Australian/UK sizing, which typically runs about one size smaller than US sizing. However, the 585 model fits relatively true to US size for most people due to its wider last design. If you wear a size 10 in most US boots, you'll likely be comfortable in a US 10 (AU 9) in the 585. For those preferring a roomier fit or who wear thick socks regularly, sizing up half a size is recommended. The included extra comfort insoles help fine-tune the fit if needed.

What's the difference between Blundstone 585 and 500?

The main differences are in comfort and construction. The 585 (Classics series) features superior shock absorption with XRD technology, softer leather requiring minimal break-in, full leather lining, and a slightly wider fit. The 500 (Original series) has the traditional Blundstone feel with a firmer sole, requires more break-in time, and costs slightly less. Both are excellent boots, but the 585 prioritizes comfort while the 500 maintains the classic experience. Most users find the small price difference worth it for the 585's enhanced comfort features.

How long do Blundstone 585 boots typically last?

With regular use, Blundstone 585 boots typically last 3-5 years, depending on usage intensity and care. The injection-molded sole construction means they can't be resoled, so lifespan depends on sole wear. However, the high-quality leather upper often outlasts the sole. With proper care including regular conditioning and rotation with other footwear, many users report 4+ years of daily wear. The investment in quality materials and construction makes them cost-effective despite the premium initial price. For occasional outdoor use, they can last significantly longer.

Can you wear Blundstone 585 boots for hiking?

Yes, the Blundstone 585 is excellent for light to moderate hiking, day hikes, and trail walking. The comfortable sole, good traction pattern, and ankle mobility make them suitable for most hiking scenarios. However, they're not designed for technical mountaineering, multi-day backpacking, or extreme terrain requiring rigid ankle support. For hiking on well-maintained trails, shorter distances, and casual outdoor exploration, they perform admirably. Many national park visitors find them ideal for sightseeing hikes and nature walks. Consider dedicated hiking boots for more demanding adventures.

Get Answers from Amazon Community

Conclusion

After three years of putting the Blundstone 585 through its paces across various terrains and conditions, I can confidently recommend these boots to anyone seeking a perfect blend of comfort, durability, and style. They've exceeded my expectations in almost every category that matters for outdoor enthusiasts and everyday wear alike.

The 585 represents the evolution of the classic Chelsea boot design, incorporating modern comfort technology without sacrificing the rugged Australian heritage that makes Blundstone boots legendary. From the first day of wear to year three, these boots have proven their worth through countless miles of trails, city streets, and everything in between. The rustic brown leather has developed a beautiful patina that tells the story of every adventure.

Who should buy the Blundstone 585:

  • Outdoor enthusiasts who want comfortable, versatile boots for day hikes and exploration
  • Urban professionals seeking boots that work for both casual and work environments
  • Travelers who need one reliable pair of boots for diverse conditions
  • Anyone who values comfort and wants to avoid traditional boot break-in periods
  • Style-conscious individuals who appreciate the timeless Chelsea boot aesthetic

Consider alternatives if: You need fully waterproof boots, require serious mountaineering support, or prefer resoleable construction.

The investment in Blundstone 585 boots pays dividends in comfort, versatility, and long-term satisfaction. While they're not the cheapest option available, the combination of premium materials, thoughtful construction, and proven durability makes them an excellent value. For those exploring national parks, navigating city streets, or simply wanting reliable everyday boots, the 585 delivers on every front.

Whether you're considering your first pair of Blundstone boots or looking to upgrade from an older model, the 585 represents the pinnacle of what modern Chelsea boots can achieve. They've earned their place in my essential outdoor gear collection and continue to be my go-to choice for most adventures and daily wear.

Shop Blundstone 585 on Amazon

For more outdoor gear reviews and national park guides, visit explorenationalparks.store
